title: What does HTML stand for?
content: Explain the full form of HTML and its purpose.
sampleAnswers: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It is used to structure content on the web using elements and tags.

title: What is the purpose of the <!DOCTYPE html> declaration?
content: Explain why <!DOCTYPE html> is important in an HTML document.
sampleAnswers: The <!DOCTYPE html> declaration tells the browser to render the page in standards mode using HTML5 syntax.

title: What is the difference between an <id> and a <class> attribute?
content: Explain when to use id and class in HTML elements.
sampleAnswers: The id attribute is unique within a page and used to identify a single element. The class attribute can be shared among multiple elements and is used for styling or scripting multiple elements at once.

title: What is the purpose of the alt attribute on tags?
content: Explain why the alt attribute is important for images.
sampleAnswers: The alt attribute provides alternative text for images, which is used by screen readers for accessibility and displayed if the image fails to load.

title: Name three HTML form input types and their purpose.
content: List three different <input> types and when they are used.
sampleAnswers: <input type="text"> for single-line text input, <input type="email"> for email input with validation, <input type="password"> for password entry masking.

title: What is the difference between <div> and <span>?
content: Explain when to use <div> and when to use <span>.
sampleAnswers: <div> is a block-level element used for grouping content and layout, while <span> is an inline element used to style or wrap a portion of text inside other elements.
